visum.title: Visum Mesoscopic Model​
visum.subtitle: A mesoscopic traffic demand prediction and operation evaluation model

howItWorks: Uses SBA (Simulation Based Assignment) with dynamic traffic assignment.
Considers time-varying traffic volume and road capacity for precise forecasting.
Connects with Vissim micro-simulation for detailed scenario evaluations.
whatItCanDo: Predicts traffic demand and congestion for large developments and major events (e.g., Olympics, Expos).
Supports optimal traffic signal plans under different development conditions.
Enables efficient, scalable traffic operation analysis for new projects.
whereItCanBeUsed: Traffic operation centers and government agencies.
Consulting projects in Korea, Saudi Arabia, UAE, Southeast Asia.

vissim.title: Vissim Microscopic Model​
vissim.subtitle: A detailed micro-simulation tool for replicating vehicle interactions

howItWorks: Connects with Visum meso-model outputs for micro-level traffic operation analysis.
Uses vehicle trajectory data for scenario evaluations.
Supports high-resolution simulation and validation of traffic control strategies.
whatItCanDo: Analyze intersection performance and optimize traffic signals.
Evaluate traffic impacts from new transport policies and infrastructure.
Generate VR/AR and driving simulator inputs for immersive scenario testing.
whereItCanBeUsed: Traffic impact assessments for new developments.
VR/AR visualizations for public agencies and transport strategy.

mesh.title: 3D Mesh Model and Visualisation
mesh.subtitle: High-quality 3D mesh models of roads and urban infrastructure for advanced visualization.

howItWorks: Uses LX data, OSM, LiDAR, and photogrammetry for 3D mesh creation.
Integrates with Visum and Vissim simulation data in Unity for seamless visual outputs.
Allows manual mesh refinement for accurate elevation and asset placement.
whatItCanDo: Create high-quality visual materials for transport policy and project communication.
Support driving simulators and VR environments for safety and operational evaluation.
Enable clear scenario comparison and visualization for non-expert stakeholders.
whereItCanBeUsed: Projects in Saudi, UAE, and Southeast Asia markets.

digitalTwin.title: Digital Twin Model
digitalTwin.subtitle: A real-time digital replica of traffic networks integrated with 3D visual environments.

howItWorks: Combines Visum meso, Vissim micro-simulations, and 3D models.
Updates dynamically with scenario changes and planned infrastructure.
Connects to ITS systems for real-time traffic visualization and scenario playback.
whatItCanDo: Visualize future traffic impacts of developments and events.
Optimize signal timing and traffic management strategies.
Enhance stakeholder understanding through immersive scenario demonstrations.
whereItCanBeUsed: Government policy testing and scenario analysis.
Public communication and VR scenario demonstrations.

naepo.title: Naepo New City Digital Twin
naepo.explanation: Dochak will position itself as a regional mobility innovation leader in Chungnam by using digital twins and simulation for traffic solutions.
naepo.detailedDescription: Developing Korea's first traffic-focused digital twin for Naepo New City to support advanced mobility planning and operations. The system integrates real-time data collection, AI-based predictive modeling, and 3D visualization to help city planners and operators make better decisions. This project plays a key role in sustainable urban development and building a smart mobility ecosystem.
naepo.impact: This project is expected to improve traffic efficiency by 30%, reduce carbon emissions by 25%, and reduce citizens' travel time by an average of 20%. It will also contribute to local economic revitalization and job creation.

impactStats.text: Traffic efficiency improvement through smart signal optimization
Reduction in vehicle emissions and environmental impact
Decrease in average commute time for residents

naepo.videoTitle: Naepo New City Digital Twin Demo
naepo.videoDescription: Demonstration video of real-time traffic monitoring and prediction system using digital twin technology.

teleDriving.title: Daejeon-Jeju Tele-driving
teleDriving.explanation: Provides remote driver intervention when autonomous vehicles encounter issues, addressing limitations of autonomous systems.
teleDriving.detailedDescription: Developing tele-driving technology for autonomous vehicles over a 500km distance between Daejeon and Jeju. Using ultra-low-latency communication via 5G networks, remote drivers can control vehicles in real-time, providing safe intervention when autonomous systems cannot handle situations. This technology can be widely applied in mobility services, logistics, and defense sectors.
teleDriving.impact: Tele-driving technology will significantly improve autonomous vehicle safety, solve driver shortage issues, and create new mobility service models. It will bring innovation especially to long-distance transportation and driving in special environments.

impactStats.text: Enhanced safety protocols and risk management systems
Reduced operational costs through remote vehicle control
Improved response times in emergency situations

teleDriving.videoDescription: Actual operation demonstration video of the Daejeon-Jeju tele-driving system.

publicTransport.title: Daejeon 3-Car Public Transportation
publicTransport.explanation: Innovating Daejeon's public transportation system to maximize traffic efficiency through 3-car connected electric train operation.
publicTransport.detailedDescription: Innovating Daejeon's existing public transportation system by building a 3-car connected electric train operation system. This system greatly improves the efficiency and convenience of public transportation through flexible vehicle deployment based on passenger demand, real-time passenger information, and integration with smart signal systems. It also implements an environmentally friendly transportation system through energy-efficient operation.
publicTransport.impact: The 3-car public transportation system is expected to improve public transportation usage by 40%, reduce waiting time by 50%, and decrease traffic congestion by 30%. It also contributes to environmental protection through reduced carbon emissions.

impactStats.text: Better route optimization and scheduling efficiency
Increased passenger satisfaction and service reliability
Reduction in fuel consumption and operational costs

publicTransport.videoDescription: Actual operation video of Daejeon's 3-car connected electric train system.

airportParking.title: Incheon Airport Parking Improvement
airportParking.explanation: Improving Incheon Airport's parking system with smart technology to maximize user convenience.
airportParking.detailedDescription: Improving Incheon Airport's parking system by integrating IoT sensors, AI-based prediction, and mobile apps into a smart parking solution. Real-time parking space guidance, reservation systems, and automatic payment functions revolutionize the parking experience for users. It also increases parking lot operational efficiency and reduces management costs.
airportParking.impact: The smart parking system will improve parking lot utilization by 60%, reduce parking time by an average of 70%, and greatly improve user satisfaction. It is also expected to reduce parking lot operational costs by 40%.

impactStats.text: Faster parking spot location and allocation through smart sensor technology
Improved user experience and convenience with real-time availability updates
Reduction in traffic congestion around airport facilities and terminals

airportParking.videoDescription: Actual operation demonstration video of Incheon Airport's smart parking system.
